content: Trade-based money laundering (TBML) involves exploiting the international trade system to transfer value and conceal the origins of illicit wealth. The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) defines TBML as disguising crime proceeds through trade transactions to legitimize their illegal source, often by misrepresenting prices, quantities, or quality of goods.
